Reserves and Academy''' consist of the [[reserve team|reserve]] and [[football academy|academy]] footballers of [[Portsmouth F.C.]]. == The Reserves == The Portsmouth Reserves consist of mainly young players under the age of 21 who are no longer eligible for the academy but are still trying to make the step up to the senior team. The reserve team is also often used to give senior squad players and senior players returning from injury the chance to play and keep or build up match fitness, or for trialists at the club to impress in a competitive match. The team was last managed by [[Guy Whittingham]] and played their matches at [[Havant & Waterlooville F.C.|Havant and Waterlooville]]'s home ground [[West Leigh Park]]. They played in the [[FA Premier Reserve League|Premier Reserve League South]]. The club announced on 7 July 2010 that they would opt out of the Totesport.com Combination Reserve League for the upcoming season, leaving the club without the ability to field a competitive reserve team.[http://www.portsmouthfc.co.uk/LatestNews/news/Blues-Opt-Out-Of-Reserve-League-1099.aspx Blues Opt Out Of Reserve League] Portsmouth FC Instead, young players are being sent out on loan to other football clubs for first-team action and a number of friendly matches will be arranged over the course of the season for the reserve players to play in. ===Other players=== *{{note|1|Note 1}}: List contains players unlisted on the clubs' official first team squad list[http://www.portsmouthfc.co.uk/squad/first-team.aspx First Team Squad] Portsmouth FC though still contracted to the club or players currently at the club without contract. *{{note|2|Note 2}}: All these players have a professional contract, but still playing for Academy. == The Academy == Portsmouth were granted academy status at the beginning of the 2007/2008 season.http://www.bbc.co.uk/hampshire/content/articles/2007/10/17/pompey_academy_feature.shtml Soccer Starlets In their first year as an academy side, they finished a highly respectable 4th place finish in the Premier League Academy Group A, beating some well established academy sides such as those of [[Southampton FC|Southampton]] and [[Crystal Palace FC|Crystal Palace]]. The academy is currently ran by [[Andy Awford]], a position formerly held at the club by [[Paul Hart]]. Currently [[Joel Ward (footballer)|Joel Ward]], [[Jason Pearce]] and [[Ryan Williams (footballer born 1993)|Ryan Williams]] are notable graduates in the first team squad. == Academy team == {|
